profile.ja:
□交流チーム再雇用職員として共同研究推進に関わる業務を担当しています。
□共同研究を通じて、研究成果を社会へ早期に確実に還元できるよう、大学、
国立研究開発法人、および民間企業との連携強化に努めています。

paper_title.en: Structure of insect chitin isolated from beetle larva cuticle and silkworm (Bombyx mori) pupa exuvia

description.en: Chitin samples in a α-form structure were isolated from beetle larva cuticle and silkworm (Bombyx mori) pupa exuvia by treatment with 1 N HCl and 1 N NaOH. Chitosan was prepared by treating them in 40% NaOH containing NaBH4. Chitin and chitosan were analyzed by X-ray, [13C]CP/MAS NMR, [13C]FT-NMR, and scanning electron microscopy (SEM) methods. Insect chitin degraded more readily than shrimp chitin when treated with 6 N HCl and the enzyme-chitinase. After treatment with 2 N HCl at 100°C, the insect chitin crystallinity increased. N-deacetylation of insect chitin was easier than that of crustaceous chitin, and about 94% of the N-acetyl groups were removed in one treatment with 40% NaOH for 4 h at 110°C. After treatment with 2 N HCl, 55% of the N-acetyl groups of silkworm chitin were removed under the same conditions. Beetle chitin showed a higher affinity for chitinase than shrimp chitin. Copyright (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V.

paper_title.en: Structure of insect chitin isolated from beetle larva cuticle and silkworm (Bombyx mori) pupa exuvia

description.en: Chitin samples in a α-form structure were isolated from beetle larva cuticle and silkworm (Bombyx mori) pupa exuvia by treatment with 1 N HCl and 1 N NaOH. Chitosan was prepared by treating them in 40% NaOH containing NaBH4. Chitin and chitosan were analyzed by X-ray, [13C]CP/MAS NMR, [13C]FT-NMR, and scanning electron microscopy (SEM) methods. Insect chitin degraded more readily than shrimp chitin when treated with 6 N HCl and the enzyme-chitinase. After treatment with 2 N HCl at 100°C, the insect chitin crystallinity increased. N-deacetylation of insect chitin was easier than that of crustaceous chitin, and about 94% of the N-acetyl groups were removed in one treatment with 40% NaOH for 4 h at 110°C. After treatment with 2 N HCl, 55% of the N-acetyl groups of silkworm chitin were removed under the same conditions. Beetle chitin showed a higher affinity for chitinase than shrimp chitin. Copyright (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V.

paper_title.ja: Physical properties of silk sericin expected from cocoon shells of silkworm varieties with different values of sericin solubility
paper_title.en: Physical properties of silk sericin expected from cocoon shells of silkworm varieties with different values of sericin solubility.

description.ja: 低温繰糸並びに水繰可能な蚕品種の繭層より抽出したセリシンの理化学的特性の品種間差異を検討した。セリシンのスラブ電気泳動測定によると, 主要な3成分のバンド (S-1, S-2, S-3) のうち, S-2の1成分に関して品種間変異を見出した。各セリシンのDSC曲線には熱分解に帰属する吸熱ピークが225°付近に認められた。さらに, 試料の結晶構造に差異は確認されなかった。これらの実験結果から, 分子量分布に現れた若干の差異はセリシンの分子形態, 結晶構造並びに熱的挙動などの特性には影響を与えないものと考察された。
description.en: The physical properties of silk sericin expected from cocoon shells of silkworm varieties with different values of sericin solubility were investigated by polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis, differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), X-ray diffraction and infrared spectroscopy (IR). The electrophoretic pattern of the silk sericin components extracted from the cocoon shell at 38°C was similar with the exception of the sericin band corresponding to S-2 (S-2′). DSC curves of silk sericin showed on endothermic peak at around 225°C which was attributed to thermal decomposition. The temperature for decomposition did not change regardless of the differences in the silkworm races. The crystalline structure of the components was similar to each other. Infrared spectra demonstrated that silk sericin displays a molecular conformation characterized by a random coil and β structure.

publisher.en: The Japanese Society of Sericultural Science

publication_name.ja: Nippon Sansigaku Zashi (The Journal of Sericultural Science of Japan), Vol. 60, No. 1, pp. 23-27 (in Japanese) Feb. 1991
publication_name.en: Journal of Insect Biotechnology and Sericology

paper_title.ja: 低温又は水繰が可能な蚕品種における繭層セリシンの構造特性
paper_title.en: Physical properties of silk sericin expected from cocoon shells of silkworm varieties with different values of sericin solubility

description.ja: 低温繰糸並びに水繰可能な蚕品種の繭層より抽出したセリシンの理化学的特性の品種間差異を検討した。セリシンのスラブ電気泳動測定によると, 主要な3成分のバンド (S-1, S-2, S-3) のうち, S-2の1成分に関して品種間変異を見出した。各セリシンのDSC曲線には熱分解に帰属する吸熱ピークが225°付近に認められた。さらに, 試料の結晶構造に差異は確認されなかった。これらの実験結果から, 分子量分布に現れた若干の差異はセリシンの分子形態, 結晶構造並びに熱的挙動などの特性には影響を与えないものと考察された。
description.en: The physical properties of silk sericin expected from cocoon shells of silkworm varieties with different values of sericin solubility were investigated by polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis, differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), X-ray diffraction and infrared spectroscopy (IR). The electrophoretic pattern of the silk sericin components extracted from the cocoon shell at 38°C was similar with the exception of the sericin band corresponding to S-2 (S-2′). DSC curves of silk sericin showed on endothermic peak at around 225°C which was attributed to thermal decomposition. The temperature for decomposition did not change regardless of the differences in the silkworm races. The crystalline structure of the components was similar to each other. Infrared spectra demonstrated that silk sericin displays a molecular conformation characterized by a random coil and β structure.

publisher.en: The Japanese Society of Sericultural Science

publication_name.en: Nippon Sansigaku Zashi (The Journal of Sericultural Science of Japan), Vol. 60, No. 1, pp. 23-27 (in Japanese) Feb. 1991

paper_title.en: Sericin components and cocoon-reelabilities in the silkworm, Bombyx mori

description.en: Silk proteins extracted from the lumen of the middle division of silkgland were examined on polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Existence of different components in sericin was demonstrated with the reduction of disulphide bonds. Three sericin components, S-A, S-B and S-C, were shown to be secreted in the anterior section of the middle silkgland, indicating that these fractions constitute the outer-most sericin layer in cocoon filament. Composition of outer-layer sericins differed among races and strains. Sericin extracts from races of low reelability percentages contained S-A but not S-B, while S-B was detected but not S-A in extracts from high reelability races. Amino acid compositions were different between S-A and S-B, and Ap/An ratio was higher in S-A sericin. This difference in the polarity of amino acid residues was also recognized when sericins were extracted from cocoon shells of low and high reelability races. Mating experiments revealed that the synthesis and secretion of sericin components, S-A and S-B, is controlled by the genes locating on the chromosome 11. Presence of other species of genes which affect cocoon reelability, possibly through spinning behavior, was also demonstrated on this chromosome. © 1988, The Japanese Society of Sericultural Science. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of Sericultural Science of Japan

paper_title.en: Sericin components and cocoon-reelabilities in the silkworm, Bombyx mori

description.en: Silk proteins extracted from the lumen of the middle division of silkgland were examined on polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Existence of different components in sericin was demonstrated with the reduction of disulphide bonds. Three sericin components, S-A, S-B and S-C, were shown to be secreted in the anterior section of the middle silkgland, indicating that these fractions constitute the outer-most sericin layer in cocoon filament. Mating experiments revealed that the synthesis and secretion of sericin components, S-A and S-B, is controlled by the genes locating on the chromosome 11. Presence of other species of genes which affect cocoon reelability, possibly through spinning behavior, was also demonstrated on this chromosome. © 1988, The Japanese Society of Sericultural Science.
